title: How can we answer a question with ''without''? - Quora

response.answer_text: Examples: “Are you planning a trip to the East Coast this autumn?” “Without knowing whether my cousin will invite me for Thanksgiving, I can’t say.” “What’s your opinion of the Governor of New York?” “Without suggesting I plan to vote for the dude, I’ve seen other governors do worse.” “Should I hike up Fifth Avenue to see the Dutch painting exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum?” “Without a hat and a heavy coat, you’ll be cold and miserable walking that far.” “Do you agree that Glenda Glitz is one of the most photogenic actresses in Hollywood?” “Without her makeup, I’ll bet she looks like the Wicked Witch.” “How fast will the city staff approve my permit?” “Without prejudging your application, I’d say it depends on whether all your plans are straightforward.” I hope that’s responsive. Obviously, there are many questions that can’t be answered starting with “Without…”; I’ve picked examples where it works.
How can we answer a question with ''without''? Without doubt that's one of the easiest questions posed on Quora!
